comments.body: I think for here it makes sense to use `TEST_CMD_1` and `TEST_CMD_2`. Would you mind changing it back? Sorry I wasn't being clear. I wanted to get rid of only `HOROVOD_TEST_CMD` because having it didn't help with readability.

I changed that code as well because the previous code was actually running TEST_CMD_2 as well which was only meant for backward compatibility and was hence throwing a warning:
"Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.python.pywrap_tensorflow' has no attribute 'IsMklEnabled'"
I see. Let's go with this then. Thank you again!
Thank you for reviewing and providing feedback. Appreciate it.
Please add a comment explaining that we need the uppercase versions because the lowercase ones don't cover all the case (or something).
Hi @penpornk to best of my knowledge I added a comment to describe why we need both set of proxies ðŸ™‚

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +89,93 @@  # In general having uppercase proxies is a good idea because different
  # applications running inside Docker may only honor uppercase proxies
  TF_DOCKER_BUILD_ARGS+=("--build-arg HTTP_PROXY=${HTTP_PROXY}")
  TF_DOCKER_BUILD_ARGS+=("--build-arg HTTPS_PROXY=${HTTPS_PROXY}")
  TF_DOCKER_BUILD_ARGS+=("--build-arg SOCKS_PROXY=${SOCKS_PROXY}")

comments.body:
Please add a comment that `TF_BUILD_VERSION` has two meanings: 
- a commit hashtag when `TF_BUILD_VERSION_IS_PR` is `no`
- a PR ID, otherwise.

It might be good to change the name to reflect the fact that it can also be a PR ID. (Not changing is fine too.)

```suggestion
    git fetch origin pull/${TF_BUILD_VERSION}/head:pr-${TF_BUILD_VERSION}
```
This made me think the command is wrong for a second, because we expect the pull request ID after `git fetch origin pull/`. 

Please also add a comment here that `TF_BUILD_VERSION` is a PR ID in this case.
